page.title: 04Settlement Development
page.content: In{1086 Ghigesburg}is recorded as having a total of{13 villiens}with{4 {ploughs,a priest,a church and a mill. In{1119}permission was granted for the building of the{Augustinian Priory which was to become the{fourth {wealthiest}in{Yorkshire}before its dissolution. The{1700s}saw{Guisborough}as the signifigant{alum producing centre}in {Britain}which effectively broke the {Italian monopoly}over the{sale of alum which was important as a{mordant {(fixative) in the dyeing of cloth. This was followed,in the{nineteenth {century,by ironstone mining}and the consequent involvement of the growing town in{Cleveland's}role is the{major {iron making centre in the world. {Today,Guisborough}continues as a {market centre}but is very much a {dormitory}town for{Teeside.
